Package com.amazonaws.mobileconnectors.lex.interactionkit.internal.audio

Class LexAudioRecorder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amazonaws.mobileconnectors.lex.interactionkit.internal.audio.AudioRecorder
      • com.amazonaws.mobileconnectors.lex.interactionkit.internal.audio.LexAudioRecorder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AudioSource, ChunkedAudioSource
    public class LexAudioRecorder
extends AudioRecorder
implements ChunkedAudioSource
    An AudioRecorder used to record audio and write audio data to an OutputStream that also supports voice activity detection and timeouts.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int SAMPLE_SIZE

        public static final int SAMPLE_SIZE

    • Constructor Detail

      • LexAudioRecorder

        public LexAudioRecorder​(android.content.Context context,
                        AudioEncoder audioEncoder,
                        VoiceActivityDetector vad,
                        AudioTimeouts audioTimeouts,
                        int numSamplesPerRead,
                        int recorderPositionNotificationPeriod,
                        android.media.AudioRecord audioRecord)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Create a new audio recorder with an existing AudioRecord object.
        Parameters:
        context - the Context used to access the AudioRecord framework.
        audioEncoder - the audio encoder to use for compression.
        vad - the VAD to be used for startpointing and endpointing.
        audioTimeouts - the audio timeouts used while recording audio.
        numSamplesPerRead - the number of samples to request when recording audio.
        recorderPositionNotificationPeriod - the notification period for updating the recorder position in milliseconds.
        audioRecord - the AudioRecord to use for audio recording.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if failed to create audio recorder instance.

      • startRecording

        public void startRecording()
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Method to setup, start the recorder, and read data. When silence is detected or the recorder is stopped by the user, clean up resources.
        Overrides:
        startRecording in class AudioRecorder
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when there are problems while recording audio.
